intro: Secamone cristata, commonly known as the crested secamone, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are borne in dense inflorescences. Secamone cristata is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
